page.title: 15TRANSPORT: WORK & RECREATION
page.content: At least one car is owned by most families in Britain today. Our class of thirty children conducted a survey and found that every family represented in the class owned one car or more, twelve families owned two cars, one family owned three cars and two families owned four cars. Although the car is the most common form of transport many other forms are also used. Local buses are used regularly, particularly by non-drivers. Many business people use trains and planes for longer journeys. Motor bikes are used by many people though only one parent in our survey owned one. For recreation, all the children in our class have push bikes and nearly half of all the parents join their children for cycling trips.
